title: Cauliflower Puree
introduction: This delightful Cauliflower Puree combines the creamy texture of mashed potatoes with the light, flavorful qualities of cauliflower. It's a fantastic alternative to traditional mashed potatoes and pairs beautifully with hearty dishes like braised beef shank.
ingredients: 3 medium boiling potatoes, peeled and quartered
instructions: Cut the cauliflower into 2-inch florets. Trim off the ends of the stems. Cut thick stems crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
In a pot large enough to hold all the vegetables, combine the potatoes with 3 quarts cold water and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes.

Add the cauliflower and cook until the vegetables are very tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the cauliflower and potatoes. Blend them until smooth with an electric mixer or hand-held blender. Do not overbeat them or the potatoes will become gluey.
Stir in the butter, cheese, and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
